title: The week in photos: Aug. 22-28, 2022
author: Kelsie Lane
description: President Samuel L. Stanley Jr., M.D., recently completed his first-ever trip to Michigan's Upper Peninsula.
cleaned_text: Aug. 29, 2022 With our first game day approaching, the [Spartan Marching Band](https://www.spartanmarchingband.com/) is hard at work polishing its moves and preparing for the big day on Sept. 2. Photo by Derrick L. Turner. Three cheers for the new school year! The MSU cheerleading team helped welcome new international students at an ice cream social hosted by the [Office for International Students and Scholars](https://oiss.isp.msu.edu/). Photo by Nick Schrader. For some Spartans, their first taste of MSU was a sweet one at the New International Students Ice Cream Social. Sparty even stopped by to pose for pictures (and maybe even sneak a scoop or two himself). Photo by Nick Schrader. A little friendly competition was the perfect way to kick off the season, as the [MSU volleyball](https://msuspartans.com/sports/womens-volleyball?path=wvball) team donned green or white to scrimmage with their fellow team members. Photo by Derrick L. Turner. The sight of laundry carts lined up outside a residence hall can only mean one thing — move-in day is finally upon us. Photo by Nick Schrader. This weekend MSU welcomed [9,800 new students](https://msutoday.msu.edu/news/2022/9800-new-spartans-arrive-on-campus-thursday) to campus, as well as thousands of returning Spartans. There's no place like home, and we're so excited to have everyone here again! Photo by Derrick L. Turner. Sparty is always happy to help welcome students to campus and spread some Spartan spirit. Photo by Derrick L. Turner. The Red Cedar River reflects the hazy blue of a late summer evening. Photo by Derrick L. Turner. Competitors hit the court at the 2022 Spartan Showdown wheelchair and standing adaptive tennis tournaments, hosted at the [MSU Tennis Center](https://msutennis.msu.edu/). Photo by Derrick L. Turner. Future doctors gathered at DeVos Performance Hall in Grand Rapids to participate in a White Coat Ceremony, marking their official entrance into the [College of Human Medicine](https://humanmedicine.msu.edu/). Photo by Derrick L. Turner. With 190 new College of Human Medicine students receiving white coats, we're confident that the future of medicine is built by SPARTANS WILL. Photo by Derrick L. Turner. A glance through the window of Wells Hall shows that there's plenty of study spots available... for now. Once fall semester classes begin on Aug. 31, campus will be filled with Spartan scholars. Photo by Nick Schrader. 01 / 12 Enjoy a curated collection of stories, photos, videos and featured content from across campus, delivered each Wednesday afternoon. Help us deliver content you're most interested in. Check the topics you would like to read about. You are now signed up to receive the MSUToday Weekly Update. The email is a quick and easy way to stay updated on the latest news about Spartans and the work they're doing on campus and around the world. Spartans Will. Jennifer Trenkamp, MSUToday editor
